items.title: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade - First Tick
items.description: The GIFT Nifty is indicating a flat to negative start for the day. Wall Street lost ground on Tuesday as investors closed the book on a remarkable year for equities, during which the U.S. stock market was powered to record highs by the twin engines of the artificial-intelligence boom and the U.S. Federal Reserve's first interest rate cuts in three-and-a-half years.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: GIFT Nifty suggests a flat to negative start; US markets fall
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Wall Street lost ground on Tuesday as investors closed the book on a remarkable year for equities, during which the U.S. stock market was powered to record highs by the twin engines of the artificial-intelligence boom and the U.S. Federal Reserve's first interest rate cuts in three-and-a-half years. The Dow Jones Industrial Average on Tuesday fell 29.51 points, or 0.07%, to 42,544.22, the S&P 500 lost 25.31 points, or 0.43%, to 5,881.63 and the Nasdaq Composite lost 175.99 points, or 0.90%, to 19,310.79.

items.title: Live: How will Nifty begin the first day of 2025? | Auto stocks in focus | Opening Bell
items.description: Benchmark indices staged a smart comeback from day's lows and ended flat in the red in the last session. Since it was the final trading day of 2024, Nifty and Sensex posted 8 percent gain last  in the overall year. January month is typically a seasonally weak one and market participants will watch out macro data, auto sales figures, Q3 results from India Inc, among others. Experts now eye Nifty resistance at 23,900 and support placed around 23,500. This morning, majority of markets are closed on account of New Year's holiday. Overnight, the US markets closed on a negative note. Among stocks in focus, watch out for Auto stocks, Thomas Cook, and Kalpataru Projects. Catch Lovisha Darad in conversation with Rajesh Palviya, Senior Vice President Research (Head Technical & Derivatives). Axis Securities and Kranthi Bathini - Equity Strategist at WealthMills Securities.

items.title: SJVN stock soars 8% after MoU with Bihar govt for Rs 5,663 crore project
items.description: In August 2022, SJVN was appointed by the Ministry of Power as the nodal agency to develop Pumped Storage Projects in Bihar, including Telharkund, Sinafdar, Panchgotia, and Hathidah Durgawati.

items.title: Agri Picks Report January 01 2025: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: According to Geojit Financial Services, Farmers in Maharashtra have sown rabi crops over 5.8 million hectares as of Monday, up 21.6% on year from 4.7 million hectares in the same period last year, according to a report released by the state agriculture department.

items.title: Easy Trip Planners' CEO Nishant Pitti resigns citing 'personal reasons'
items.description: EaseMyTrip is the brand operated by the listed Easy Trip Planner. Shares worth Rs 53 crore of Easy Trip were sold in a block deal on December 31, with co-founder Nishant Pitti being the seller.
